results.title: Basic metalwork: soft soldering. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: An explanation of the fundamentals of soldering. Fluxes and the principles of tinning and sweating; choice of bit; preparing the bit; joints relying on capillary action; preparation of “killed spirits” and the prevention of corrosion and use of resin in flux. No other credits available.
results.description: An explanation of the fundamentals of soldering. results.title: Basic law terms
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Directions Unlimited Film Corporation, Noel Nosseck and Robert Gordon
results.brief_description: Shows young people how the law can work for them rather than against them. Distinguishes civil law from criminal law, provides a dramatised explanation of torts and contracts, and defines the medieval practice of “outlawing” people for he who defies the law is outside of it. Presented by Joseph Campanella.

results.title: Basic job skills: handling responsibility
results.brief_description: Shows students how to handle several situations in which supervisors, employees and co-workers face and accept responsibilities, and deal with their independent roles. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels and tertiary level.

results.title: Basic instinct (E)
results.creator_credit: Carolco Pictures, Studio Canal+, Alan Marshall and Paul Verhoeven
results.brief_description: Destined to become a modern classic, Paul Verhoeven’s effort has brought new definition and brilliance to the “femme fatale” of the film noir genre. It is all here, temptation, sex and murder, and all in the guise of a voluptuous beautiful woman. Michael Douglas plays an ex-undercover cop, burnt out and recovering from drug and alcohol addiction when he becomes involved with the investigation of a brutal murder. The prime suspect is a very rich, very beautiful young woman (Sharon Stone) who’s calm and collected exterior belies a predatory and hedonistic soul. Shocking, controversial and explicit, this is not a film for the squeamish. Co-starring George Dzundza.

results.brief_description: Gives practical demonstrations of the best ways to film a variety of subjects, intercut with comic situations of things that can go wrong. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic film language
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre, Ross Campbell and Ivan Gaal
results.brief_description: Shows the basic language of camera work in a clear and linear style within the context of a planned film. In two parts; “The Encounter”, the first part, is silent and shows Bob Thornycroft and Joe Bolza mime an encounter between death and a grave digger. “The Elements in Detail”, the second part, shows all the film techniques used being carefully analysed as the action is repeated and also analyses different shots that can be used by students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre, Ross Campbell and Ivan Gaal

results.title: Basic film editing
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films and Paul Burnford Educational Films
results.brief_description: This film illustrates basic techniques of piecing a film together. The camera viewpoint, as well as long, medium and close-up shots, are manipulated to vary effects. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic electricity
results.brief_description: An explanation in simple terms of the fundamentals of electricity, including voltage, current, resistance, magnetic fields, induction, primary and secondary coils, series and parallel circuits. No other credits available.
